communications.subject: Alaska Public Records Act Request: Alaska DOC transgender policies
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Alaska Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All department policy and guidance documents regarding transgender inmates, including but not limited to gender-affirming medical care, housing and treatment by staff. I also request records of any proposed and/or enacted changes to said policies made on or after Nov. 6, 2024 until date of search, if such documents exist.

I request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ileana Garnand

communications.subject: Alaska DOC public records receipt / transgender policies
communications.communication:
On May 7, 2025, the Alaska Department of Corrections (DOC) received your public records request (PRR).



You requested the following:



[cid:image001.png@01DBBF3A.3BE17000]

Per AS 40.25.122 and 2 AAC 96.220, the Department may ask if a requester is a party or represents a party in an administrative or judicial litigation with the state in which a requested record is relevant. If the answer is YES, the requester must seek the records in accordance with the rules of procedure applicable in the administrative or judicial proceeding.

Please "reply" to this email: Are you such a requestor? (currently in litigation with the State of Alaska)
Yes or no.

Respectfully,
Betsy

[cid:image002.png@01DBBF3A.3BE17000]

communications.subject: RE: Alaska Public Records Act Request: Alaska DOC transgender policies
communications.communication:
No, I am not such a requestor. I do not represent any party currently in litigation with the State of Alaska.

Thank you.

communications.subject: Alaska Public Records Act receipt / transgender policies
communications.communication:
Thank you.



Please note this acknowledgment is no guarantee any responsive records exist in the form you are requesting. If responsive records are located, then those documents allowable for release will be made available to you in ten working days of receipt (May 21, 2025) as allowed by 2AAC 96.325.



It is important to note there may be a cost associated with public records searches, an estimate of which is based on the parameters of your search. Alaska Statute 40.25.110 (c) allows “if the production of records for one requester in a calendar month exceeds five person-hours, the public agency shall require the requester to pay the personnel costs required during the month to complete the search and copying tasks.” Additionally, you would need to pay the fee before the records are disclosed. If it is determined this request will exceed five person hours, I can provide you with an estimated cost of the search. Please note that the estimate is for costs associated with searching DOC records and is no guarantee that any responsive records exist. We may not locate any records responsive to your request, and you will still be charged the search fee. If responsive records are located, then those documents allowable for release will be made available to you.



For clarification, please refer to AS 40.25.115 (a) which says, “activities authorized under this section may not take priority over the primary responsibilities of the public agency.” Additionally, DOC P&P 108.07 (VII) (B) states “no response shall be sent to a requestor prior to informing and consulting with the Commissioner, Division Director and Department of Law.”

Betsy
Betsy Holley
Alaska DOC

communications.subject: Alaska DOC public records response / transgender policies
communications.communication:
May 21, 2025

Ileana Garnand
Muckrock News
Via email: 186207-59259290@requests.muckrock.com

Ileana Garnand,

I am responding to your May 7, 2025, public records request for:
"all department [1] policy and guidance documents regarding transgender inmates, including but not limited to gender-affirming medical care, housing and treatment by staff. I also request records of any [2] proposed and/or enacted changes to said policies made on or after Nov. 6, 2024 until date of search, if such documents exist."

Request #1: Our complete Policies and Procedures are available in the public domain and as such, we are not required to provide them (2 AAC 96.100 (b)). I draw your attention to the following policy numbers:

  *   202.15: Standards of Conduct
  *   804.01: Special Management Prisoners
  *   806.02: Prisoner Hygiene, Grooming and Sanitation
  *   806.04: Prisoner Uniform
  *   807.02: Access to Health Care Services
  *   807.05: Use of Pharmaceutical Products
  *   807.09: Medical Experimentation
  *   807.23: Treatment and Management of Gender Dysphoria
  *   807.24: Treatment and Management of Female Prisoners
  *   808.09: Prisoner Housing
  *   808.10 Prisoner Marriages
  *   811.04: Search Upon Admission
  *   811.05: Prisoner Property
  *   811.08: Prisoner Orientation
  *   812.10 Prisoner Employment
The (2022) Alaska DOC Gender Dysphoria Clinical Care Guide is attached.

Additionally, we use the following resources, available online: National Commission on Correctional Health Care (NCCHC) Standards for Health Services in Prisons, NCCHC Standards for Health Services in Jails, and NCCHC Standards for Mental Health Services in Correctional Facilities.

Request #2: No such records exist.

By regulation, this response technically constitutes a partial denial of your records request (because certain records you request do not exist).  For that reason, I am required to provide you the following information. I have been delegated the authority to deny public records requests for the Department of Corrections; you may administratively appeal this denial to the agency head, by complying with the procedures of 2 AAC 96.340.  You may pursue immediate judicial review of this denial by seeking an injunction from the Superior court under AS 40.25.125.  Choosing not to pursue an injunction in Superior court will have no adverse effect on your rights in the administrative appeal.  An administrative appeal from the denial of a request for public records requires no appeal bond.  Copies of 2 AAC 96.335 - 2 AAC 96.350 are enclosed.


Respectfully,
Betsy

[cid:image001.png@01DBC8A1.D796B670]

title: Eltife and Rathgerber text messages with Robert Black

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Eltife and Rathgerber text messages with Robert Black
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any emails, text messages, or other one-to-one or one-to-many forms of communication between either Kevin Eltife or Julia Rathgerber, on the one hand, and Robert Black, on the other. This request is limited to emails or text messages on or after January 1, 2025. This request is not (and can not be) limited based on subject matter or keyword.

Please note that this request seeks public records wherever they may be found, including on devices or networks owned or operated by private parties. For example, if an employee uses a personal cell phone or social media account to conduct public business, records created, maintained, or held on the phone or account are public records subject to this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: Confirmation Receipt
communications.communication: The University of Texas System has received your request for information and will respond in a timely manner as required by Section 552.221 of the Texas Government Code.   System’s hours of normal operation are from 8:00am to 5:00pm Monday through Friday.  If your request was submitted after business hours (after 5 pm but before midnight) it is considered received the next business day.

communications.subject: RE: Texas Public Information Act Request: Eltife and Rathgerber text messages with Robert Black
communications.communication:
Hi Adam,

Attached, please find our briefing to the Texas Attorney General's Office regarding your below request to UT System.

Please note that we are only seeking to withhold a small portion of the responsive information as draft legislative language, under sections 552.106 and 552.111, as outlined in the attached correspondence. I have provided notice to both the Office of the Governor of Texas and the Office of the Lieutenant Governor of Texas to allow them the opportunity to object to the release of certain responsive documents. I have given those offices a deadline to reply to me regarding the notice. Depending on the responses from those entities, I will provide you with an update and/or the information with redactions of the portions we are seeking to withhold, on May 21, 2025 by 5:00 PM. See TEX. GOV'T CODE § 552.221.

Thank you,

Cynthia Tynan
Associate General Counsel & Public Information Coordinator
Office of General Counsel
The University of Texas System
210 W. 7th Street
Austin, TX 78701
Direct 512.499.4505 | E-mail ctynan@utsystem.edu<mailto:ctynan@utsystem.edu>

title: Request for Correctional Mental Health Staff Directory and Contact Information (Department of Correctional Services)

communications.subject: Nebraska Public Records Act Request: Request for Correctional Mental Health Staff Directory and Contact Information (Department of Correctional Services)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nebraska Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting a list of currently employed mental health professionals within your state's Department of Corrections or its subsidiary agencies, as well as their contact information.

Specifically, I am requesting:

- Full names
- Job titles
- Assigned correctional facility
- Government-issued email addresses
- Government-issued phone numbers (direct desk numbers if available, otherwise department phone numbers with or without extensions)
- Department/division (e.g. Behavioral Health, Mental Health Services)

This request applies to the following roles: rehabilitative program coordinators, licensed psychologists, psychiatrists, clinical social workers, and other licensed mental health professionals serving incarcerated populations in state-operated facilities.

If available, I request this information be provided in a machine-readable format such as CSV or Excel.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Ma

title: Written Correspondence Regarding The VCOEB Federal Asvosory Committee (05/01/2022 - Present) (Department of Veterans Affairs, Veterans Health Administration)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of all written communications (including but not limited to emails) which were created, written, distributed, facsimiled and / or electronically transmitted between the dates of May 1st 2022 and one day before Responsive documents are provided to me in Response to this Request - regarding, whether directly or indirectly, the Veterans and Community Oversight and Engagement Board Federal Advisory Committee (aka VCOEB); wherein any one or more of the following persons are recipients, senders and / or distributors of said written correspondence:

Denis McDonough, Secretary of the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs

Steven Braverman, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as a VA Greater Los Angeles Healthcare System Medical Center Director)

Robert Merchant, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as a VA Greater Los Angeles Healthcare System Executive Director)

Chihung Szeto, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs Veterans Experience Office (often referred to as a VCOEB Federal Advisory Committee Administrator)

Eugene W. Skinner, U.S. Department
of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as a Defense Consultant, Federal Acquisitions Expert & Federal Advisory Committee Administrator)

Keith Harris, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as a Senior Executive Homelessness Agent for Greater Los Angeles)

Alan Trinh, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as a Contract Officer and Deputy Director)

Michael J. Missal, Inspector General of the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs

Michael W. Fisher, an executive with the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as a Network Director of VISN 22)

Matthew MacGahran, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as a Chief of Community Engagement And Re-Integration Services)

Brett Simms, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as an Executive Director of the Office Of Asset Enterprise Management)

Jon J. Rychalski, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as the Chief Financial Officer of the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs *even though he appears to have no Certified Public Account License)

Any and all U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs Police Officers working at the West Los Angeles VA Soldiers Home aka VA Greater Los Angeles Healthcare System West Los Angeles VA Medical Center

I am technically qualified as a journalist.  My work is performed on an independent, unpaid volunteer basis.  This specific Request regarding recent written correspondence Records involving approximately 15 specified Public Officials within the specified period, pertaining to a Federal Advisory Committee Legislated under Public Law 114-226 and Chartered to "improve outcomes for homeless Veterans" is not made nor intended to be used for commercial purposes.  It does regard, among other things: a Public Service, Public Meetings, Open Sessions and matters related to a Federal Advisory Committee.

Additional background information regarding the VCOEB is provided to interested parties at the following links for educational and contextually informative purposes which may offer significant insights in support of the Lawful operation of Federal Advisory Committees operating in Our Nation's Capital of Veteran Homelessness:

https://www.instagram.com/reel/CiPiS97jIid/?igshid=YmMyMTA2M2Y=

https://www.instagram.com/reel/ChqrwoNDt4H/?igshid=YmMyMTA2M2Y=

https://www.instagram.com/p/CfKWzSev017/?igshid=YmMyMTA2M2Y=

https://www.instagram.com/p/CiGkVwmvw3M/?igshid=YmMyMTA2M2Y=

https://www.instagram.com/reel/Chr39g_j7qG/?igshid=YmMyMTA2M2Y=

https://www.instagram.com/tv/CU-MvrhDuAI/?igshid=YmMyMTA2M2Y=

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ryan Thompson

communications.subject: Acknowledgement Letter 23-00135;00499;00566;00567;00568;00569;00570-F (Thompson)
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Thompson,


This letter acknowledges receipt of your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) dated October 5, 2022, in which you requested:


  *   Copies of all written communications (including but not limited to emails) which were created, written, distributed, facsimiled and / or electronically transmitted between the dates of May 1, 2022, and one day before Responsive documents are provided to me in Response to this Request - regarding, whether directly or indirectly, the Veterans and Community Oversight and Engagement Board Federal Advisory Committee (aka VCOEB); wherein any one or more of the following persons are recipients, senders and / or distributors of said written correspondence:



  *   Denis McDonough, Secretary of the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs
  *   Steven Braverman, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as a VA Greater Los Angeles Healthcare System Medical Center Director)
  *   Robert Merchant, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as a VA Greater Los Angeles Healthcare System Executive Director)
  *   Chihung Szeto, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs Veterans Experience Office (often referred to as a VCOEB Federal Advisory Committee Administrator)
  *   Eugene W. Skinner, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as a Defense Consultant, Federal Acquisitions Expert & Federal Advisory Committee Administrator)
  *   Keith Harris, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as a Senior Executive Homelessness Agent for Greater Los Angeles)
  *   Alan Trinh, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as a Contract Officer and Deputy Director)
  *   Michael J. Missal, Inspector General of the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs
  *   Michael W. Fisher, an executive with the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as a Network Director of VISN 22)
  *   Matthew MacGahran, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as a Chief of Community Engagement and Re-Integration Services)
  *   Brett Simms, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as an Executive Director of the Office of Asset Enterprise Management)
  *   Jon J. Rychalski, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as the Chief Financial Officer of the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs *even though he appears to have no Certified Public Account License)



  *   Any and all U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs Police Officers working at the West Los Angeles VA Soldiers Home aka VA Greater Los Angeles Healthcare System West Los Angeles VA Medical Center




The FOIA Service received your request on October 18, 2022, and assigned it FOIA tracking numbers 23-00135-F; 23-00499-F; 23-00566-F; 23-00567-F; 23-00568-F; 23-00569-F; and 23-00570-F.  Please refer to these numbers when communicating with the VA about this request.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Written Correspondence Regarding The VCOEB Federal Asvosory Committee (05/01/2022 - Present) (Department of Veterans Affairs, Veterans Health Administration)
communications.communication:
Veterans Health Administration:

Please review the attached and urgent folowup and response to your improper attempt to close this Request without satisfactory Response.  The attached file is named RT-VHA_FOIA_11222022_R1.pdf

For your and the Public's convenience, text of the body of the attached Letter portion of the aforementioned, urgent followup - follows below.  Note the attachement must be reviewed to review the cited Appendices.

____________________________________________________________________

November 22nd, 2022


TO:

U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs
Veterans Health Administration
Office of the Inspector General
Washington DC, USA


CC:

Denis McDonough, Secretary of the U.S Department of Veterans Affairs
Michael J. Missal, Inspector General of the U.S Department of Veterans Affairs
Luis-Vasquez Contes, American GI Forum National Commander
Lawrence Romo, American GI Forum National Legislative Director
Esau Herrera, American GI Forum CA State Commander
Francisco Juarez, American GI Forum El Camino Real Chapter Legislative Officer 
Richard Southern, Vietnam Veterans of America National Board Member
Sennet Devermont, Always For The People
Cable News Network
Mirror Media Group
Muckrock News


RE:

Followup on 10/05/0222 US DVA VHA FOIA Request (Ryan Thompson)
US DVA FOIA Tracking Numbers include: 23-00135-F, 23-00499-F, 23-00566-F,
23-00567-F, 23-00568-F, 23-00569-F, 23-00570-F & 23-00006-FOIA


VIA:  Muckrock News & E-Mail


U.S Department of Veterans Affairs VHA, OIG & Related FOIA Staff:


On 10/05/2022, I submitted an FOIA Request to the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs Veterans Health Administration; regarding copies of written communications by, as well as received by; specified U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs Officials between 05/01/2022 and Present - about the Veterans And Community Oversight And Engagement Board (VCOEB) Federal Advisory Committee that's Chartered under the Federal Advisory Committee Act, Mandated by Public Law 114-226 as well as regulated by the Administrative Procedures Act.  A copy of the Request is attached to this Letter as "Appendix A".

On 10/20/2022, the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs Veterans Health Administration (VHA) Acknowledged receiving my FOIA Request on 10/18/2022 and reported the following Tracking Numbers for it: 23-00135-F, 23-00499-F, 23-00566-F, 23-00567-F, 23-00568-F, 23-00569-F, 23-00570-F.  Veterans Health Administration stated in that Acknowledgement that the Requested Records, if they exist, will be maintained by Veterans Health Administration; as well as other divisions of the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs, including the VA Office of the Inspector General, all of which VHA is coordinating with to satisfy the Request.  A copy of VHA's 10/20/2022 Acknowledgement is attached to this Letter within "Appendix A".

On 11/17/2022, I received an "Agency Final Response" to my FOIA Request from Government Information Specialist Barya Offer, on behalf of the Office of the Inspector General for the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs.  The sum of Offer's purported "Agency Final Response" is, "please see the Agency Final Response regarding your request"; with an attached PDF file named "Agency Final Response No Records - Full Denial.pdf".  Said file is a letter from Supervisory Government Information Specialist Ruthhee G. Bellamy of the VA OIG Release Information Office - notifying me that VA OIG assigned Tracking Number 23-00006-FOIA to my Request, among other things.  A copy of VHA's 11/17/2022 "Agency Final Response" is included in the "Appendix A" attachment to this Letter.

The "Agency Final Response No Records - Full Denial" letter from VA OIG on 11/17/2022 is attached to this Letter as "Appendix B"; and declares "we were unable to locate any responsive records pertaining to your request"; yet only as the Request pertains to Inspector General Michael J. Missal in VA OIG Records.  Unfortunately, VA OIG's Response to my Request is a false statement of fact; provable by one of many Records in my possession which would have to be included in any satisfactory Response to my Request, notwithstanding whether that Response is from VA OIG, VHA or otherwise applicable officse / divisions of US DVA.

The aforementioned Record in my possession is an e-mail I sent to Inspector General Missal and others on 05/27/2022 regarding VCOEB, that a simple search for the text "VCOEB" will produce upon querying Inspector General Missal's e-mail correspondence between 05/01/2022 and Present.  Given that e-mail was not returned to sender and Inspector General Missal directly corresponded with me several times in the recent past from the same e-mail address; and because information about a Federal Advisory Committee that holds Public Meetings in Open Session on Public land for Public attendance (as Publicly Noticed in the Federal Register), is not qualified to be suppressed due limited National Security provisions under 5 U.S.C. Statutes governing FOIA - apparently the minimum effort to satisfactorily Respond to my Request is beyond some U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs Officials' intent to perform...  Despite VA OIG's purported "Agency Final Response No Records - Full Denial" Letter probably cost Federal Taxpayer's far more to produce than performing the simple searches to lawfully satisfy and Respond to my Request will; presuming Public Records required to satisfy my Request were not unlawfully tampered with. Even in that hypothetical scenario though, the Records are obtainable from one of many archives US DVA is Mandated to retain as National Security against the tampering or loss of such Records.  A copy of my aforementioned 05/27/2022 e-mail to Inspector General Missal and one of many e-mails Inspector General Missal sent me from the same address he received my 05/27/2020 e-mail at, are attached to this Letter as "Appendix C".
Notwithstanding the validity or lack thereof in VA OIG's Response to a portion of my Request through VHA, the partial Response is not a legitimate, full Response to my Request; despite it being uncannily misrepresented as such by false statements of fact.

The Agency is at least procedurally failing to Respond to my Request on time in accordance with Federal Public Law.  I reassure you the Requested Records regarding a Federal Advisory Committee with a Public Law Mandate and Charter to improve outcomes for Veterans via Public Meetings held in Open Session here in Our Nation's Capital of Veteran Homelessness - are delays of Public Records offering a direct positive impact on disabled homeless Veterans' probability of survival and General Welfare of U.S. Taxpayers  Contrarily, the ongoing and baseless delays Responding to my Request are negatively impacting disabled homeless Veterans and Federal Taxpayers, until and unless the Request is fully and legitimately Responded to.

Given my maintained Good Faith in the majority of Our U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs Staff's Public Integrity and capacity to ethically perform their duties in accordance with the Department's true Mission - I expect nothing less than the People of the United States of America do in this matter; a swift, comprehensive, accurate and satisfactory Response to my Request in accordance with Our Rights, Public Laws and increasing expenditures to expect no less of Our U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs' performance in respect thereof.

I declare under under penalty of perjury that the foregoing is true and correct.  Executed on November 22nd, 2022 in Los Angeles, California by:



Ryan Thompson


Independent Volunteer Civil Rights Advocate & Reporter
Member, American GI Forum Congressionally Chartered VSO
NHDVS.net
rt@nhdvs.net

C/o Muckrock News
DEPT MR 103928
263 Huntington Avenue
Boston, MA 02115

communications.subject: VA FOIA Request #23-00566-F
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Thompson:

This letter is the second agency decision regarding your October 5, 2022, electronic Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) requests to the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA). The Office of Information and Technology (OI&T) received your requests and assigned it FOIA tracking number 23-00556-F.  For the reasons outlined below, your requests are granted/denied in part.

1st Initial Request & IAD

Copies of all written communications (including but not limited to emails) which were created, written, distributed, facsimiled and / or electronically transmitted between the dates of May 1st 2022 and one day before Responsive documents are provided to me in Response to this Request - regarding, whether directly or indirectly, the Veterans and Community Oversight and Engagement Board Federal Advisory Committee (aka VCOEB); wherein any one or more of the following persons are recipients, senders and / or distributors of said written correspondence:

(4) Chihung Szeto, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs Veterans Experience Office (often referred to as a VCOEB Federal Advisory Committee Administrator)

(5) Eugene W. Skinner, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as a Defense Consultant, Federal Acquisitions Expert & Federal Advisory Committee Administrator)





Mark Littlefield
FOIA Officer

Enclosure: 20 pages w/held in part under (b)(6)

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Written Correspondence Regarding The VCOEB Federal Asvosory Committee (05/01/2022 - Present) (Department of Veterans Affairs, Veterans Health Administration)
communications.communication:
On 10/05/2022 I, Ryan Thompson, Requested the Following Information from US DVA via FOIA...

Copies of all written communications (including but not limited to emails) which were created, written, distributed, facsimiled and / or electronically transmitted between the dates of May 1st 2022 and one day before Responsive documents are provided to me in Response to this Request - regarding, whether directly or indirectly, the Veterans and Community Oversight and Engagement Board Federal Advisory Committee (aka VCOEB); wherein any one or more of the following persons are recipients, senders and / or distributors of said written correspondence:

Denis McDonough, Secretary of the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs

Steven Braverman, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as a VA Greater Los Angeles Healthcare System Medical Center Director)

Robert Merchant, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as a VA Greater Los Angeles Healthcare System Executive Director)

Chihung Szeto, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs Veterans Experience Office (often referred to as a VCOEB Federal Advisory Committee Administrator)

Eugene W. Skinner, U.S. Department
of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as a Defense Consultant, Federal Acquisitions Expert & Federal Advisory Committee Administrator)

Keith Harris, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as a Senior Executive Homelessness Agent for Greater Los Angeles)

Alan Trinh, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as a Contract Officer and Deputy Director)

Michael J. Missal, Inspector General of the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs

Michael W. Fisher, an executive with the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as a Network Director of VISN 22)

Matthew MacGahran, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as a Chief of Community Engagement And Re-Integration Services)

Brett Simms, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as an Executive Director of the Office Of Asset Enterprise Management)

Jon J. Rychalski, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as the Chief Financial Officer of the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs *even though he appears to have no Certified Public Account License)

Any and all U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs Police Officers working at the West Los Angeles VA Soldiers Home aka VA Greater Los Angeles Healthcare System West Los Angeles VA Medical Center

... On 11/17/2022 a Supervisory Government Information Specialist in the VA OIG Release of Information Office named Ruthlee G. Bellamy Falsely Responded that VA OIG posessed none of the Requested Information as pertaining to VA OIG Michael J. Missal.

On 12/12/2022 US DVA FOIA Officer as well as Management and Program ANALYST Mark Littlefield Responded on behalf of US DVA with a total of 8 e-mail records pertaining to only two of the Request's identified subjects; namely VA Officers Chihung Szeto and Eugene Skinner.

On 12/28/2022 - a Government Informaiton Specialist in the VA Office of Inspector General Information Release Office named Ms. Johnson Responded with some to all requested Information Requested as pertains to VA OIG Michael Missal.  While thankful for the provided Information Requested, the partial Response thoroughly proves that: a) VA OIG via Ruthlee G. Bellamy provided a False and / or otherwise improper "Final Agency Response" of "Full Denial" and b) given the Fact some of the Requested Information provided via Ms. Johnson contains such regarding Eugene Skinner and Chihung Szeto that is not in ANALYST Mark Littlefield's Response for such information; it's apparent Mr. Littlefield's account of the search for such Requested Information is False, erroneous or reliant upon False information directly provided by Eugene Skinner and Chihung Szeto.

To date none of the Requested Information regarding Mr.s Harris, Trinh, McDonough, Merchant, Braverman, MacGahran, Simms, Rychalski and VAPD has been provided; and in light of False, erroneous and / or misleading information so slowly provided in Response to this Request - there's evident concern for a lack of integrity and violation of Federal Public Law governing FOIA.  I respectfully demand a diligent, full, complete, honest and lawful Response to my long overdue Request pertaining to Public Officials' Federal Advisory Committee records pertaining to the VCOEB within the Request's specified time period without further delay and apparent suppression of said Information which the U.S. Federal Government is mandated to provide.

Sincerely, 

Ryan Thompson

communications.communication:
Hello,

Thank you for contacting the GLA FOIA Office to check the status of your FOIA Request 23-00569-F. The FOIA Office is in the review and redaction process of your request. Our office hopes to have your request completed within the next few weeks. Your patience is greatly appreciated. Please feel free to contact our office with any future questions or concerns regarding your request.

communications.subject: VACO FOIA - 23-00499-F Still Interested
communications.communication:
We are writing to confirm whether you are still interested in the FOIA request below. Due to staffing changes, we were unable to confirm whether we previously responded to this request. In accordance with the Department of Justice (DOJ), Office of Information Policy (OIP), July 2015 guidance on still-interested inquiries, https://www.justice.gov/oip/limitations-use-still-interested-inquiries, we are providing you with 30 working days to confirm whether you are still interested in this FOIA request. If we do not hear from you within 30 working days we will administratively close this request. You can file a new request for the same information at any time. 

Thank you for your patience as we work on improving our FOIA program and clear our backlogged FOIA requests. 

If you should have any questions, please feel free to contact me at . 
Sincerely, 
Kelli Ware , FOIA Officer 

FOIA REQUEST 23-00499-F

The FOIA # 23-00568-F, is closed.  The requester was provided a still interested letter on April 22, 2024 and by June 11, 2024 there was no response and an IAD was issued and the request closed the same date.  The documents provided to the requester were received by their office and uploaded in their own system as evident with the link they have provided down below.  It is past the 90 days for any appeal, so the next step if they want to pursue the same request below is to submit a new request to the VA FOIA Public Access Link at: https://vapal.efoia-host.com/app/Home.aspx.

Attached to this email is the exact correspondence from their own link to files the requester received from the VISN22FOIA Office.

Veronica Lopez

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: BLM Colorado Trespass Log
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of any spreadsheets or logs that documented unauthorized grazing use, i.e. trespass, on BLM-administered grazing lands in Colorado that occurred during the year 2024.  This request seeks records produced by the BLM Colorado state office, and/or its field offices. It seeks a spreadsheet or copy of the databases or logs for all reports of unauthorized use that occurred between January 1, 2024 and December 31, 2024. For an example of the type of documents I seek, see the attached document.

I am a reporter with High Country News

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jimmy Tobias

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Evergreen Solutions (Monroe Community College)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:


Subject: Request for Public Records - 

Greetings,

I hope this email finds you well. We at Evergreen Solutions, LLC, are conducting a compensation study on behalf of our client and I am writing to make a formal open records request. We are requesting an electronic copy of your staff and faculty (if applicable) database as well as relevant documents such as job descriptions, collective bargaining agreements, and pay plans. I am able to send survey templates to assist with the data collection; however, we will accept data in the manner most convenient for you.

Staff Census Information requested:

Job Titles
Classification Title
Pay Grades
Pay Ranges (Minimum and Maximum)
Actual Salaries
Full-Time Equivalent (FTE) Status
Staff Handbook

I also kindly request answers to the following questions related to the compensation study:

How are salaries adjusted for your organization (e.g., COLA, Longevity, performance, etc.)?
What is your current turnover rate?
What is your current average tenure for an employee?
Date your current compensation plan was implemented.
Date of the last salary adjustment?
How frequently are job descriptions updated?

For the faculty database, I am requesting the following information:

Faculty Census:
Rank (if applicable)
Classification Title (if faculty holds other positions other than teaching such as Dean, Chair, Coordinators,etc)
Highest Degree Held
Pay Grade
Pay Ranges (Min& Max)
Current Step (if on a step plan)
Contract Length (in days and/or months)
Annual Base Salary with no additives
Annual Salary with any additives
Discipline (Not to be confused with department, the distinct/specific subject the faculty member teaches; Ex: Microbiology)
Department
CIP Code (if available - by individual incumbent)

Additionally, copies of the following documents, if available:

Copy of all faculty pay plans
Employee Benefit Information (Holidays Off, Health Insurance, Etc)
Salary Adjustment Policy (Longevity, performance, COLA, etc)
Any Collective Bargaining Agreements
Current Turnover Rate
Current Average Tenure
Date that your current pay plan was implemented
Date of your last salary adjustment to pay plan
How frequently are your job descriptions updated
Do you have a planned salary adjustment to your compensation structures for the next fiscal year? If so, by what amount?
Please list/attach and supplements/additives that faculty are compensated for duties outside of instruction
Faculty Handbooks
Adjunct Rates/Pay Plan
Overload Rates
Rates for compensation for faculty leadership- Deans, Coordinators, Department Chairs
Do you compensate faculty differently based on area of discipline? If yes, please provide details.
Do you have any form of additional compensation for Large Class Size? If yes, please provide details.
Do you have an education incentive at your institution? If yes, please provide details.

I understand that public records requests may involve administrative processes and associated fees, as allowed by law. Please inform me of any fees and the estimated timeframe for fulfilling this request. If any portion of this request is denied, please provide a written explanation for the denial, citing the specific legal grounds for the refusal.

Please consider this email as a formal request for public records under the applicable open records laws. If there are any questions or additional details needed to process this request, please do not hesitate to contact me.

I look forward to your prompt attention to this matter and the timely provision of the requested information. Your cooperation in ensuring transparency and access to public records is greatly appreciated.

Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to mandatory exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive?: Yes
Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to discretionary exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive? Yes

Email: alisia@consultevergreen.com

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alisia Rios

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Evergreen Solutions (Monroe Community College)
communications.communication:
Dear Alisia Rios,



I hope this message finds you well. The attached is in response to your request under NYS Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) for Monroe Community College to produce a electronic copy of its staff and faculty (if applicable) database as well as relevant documents such as job descriptions, collective bargaining agreements, and pay plans,  which was dated March 6, 2025. Please find attached a partial approval for the following documents:



  *   Date your current compensation plan was implemented. This is based on when the negotiations processes are finalized under each Collective bargaining Agreement (CBA).  Our non-contract and senior leaders follow the Faculty Association contract.
  *   Date of the last salary adjustment?  9/1/2024
  *   How frequently are job descriptions updated? As needed, including when there is a need for a job audit under Civil Service, when a department completes an organization redesign, or when kicking off recruitment/postings
  *   Faculty Census:
Rank (if applicable) - outlined within the attached Faculty CBA
Classification Title (if faculty holds other positions other than teaching such as Dean, Chair, Coordinators, etc) outlined within the attached Faculty CBA
Highest Degree Held - depends on the role, is further outlined within the attached Faculty CBA
Pay Grade - identified within attached CBA
Pay Ranges (Min& Max) identified within attached CBA
Current Step (if on a step plan) - different based on factors outlined within attached CBA
Contract Length (in days and/or months) - see attached Faculty CBA
Annual Base Salary with no additives - see attached Faculty CBA
Annual Salary with any additives - additives are identified as stipends, as outlined within the attached CBA
Discipline (Not to be confused with department, the distinct/specific subject the faculty member teaches; Ex: Microbiology)
Department - outlined within the attached headcount report
  *   Copy of all faculty pay plans  - see attached Faculty CBA
  *   Employee Benefit Information (Holidays Off, Health Insurance, Etc) - see attached benefit guides
  *   Salary Adjustment Policy (Longevity, performance, COLA, etc.) - see attached CBAs
  *   Any Collective Bargaining Agreements - See attached
     *   Current Turnover Rate - see above
     *   Current Average Tenure - see above
     *   Date that your current pay plan was implemented - see above
     *   Date of your last salary adjustment to pay plan - see above
     *   How frequently are your job descriptions updated - see above
  *   Do you have a planned salary adjustment to your compensation structures for the next fiscal year? If so, by what amount? - see attached Faculty CBA



The following were denied on grounds that the college does not track such data, and per NYS FOIL law we are not mandated to produce or generate document that doesn't already exist:

  *   What is your current turnover rate?
  *   What is your current average tenure for an employee?



Note that we have minimally redacted some of the attached records to protect college overall functions.


You have the right to appeal this decision. If you choose to do so, please direct your appeal to Darrell Jachim-Moore, interim Chief Financial Officer and Vice President of Administrative Services, Monroe Community College, 1000 E. Henrietta Rd., Rochester, NY 14623, or via email at djachim-moore@monroecc.edu<mailto:djachim-moore@monroecc.edu> within 30 days.





Sincerely,



Brenda Ronan

Records Access Officer


Brenda Ronan
Institutional Compliance Officer & Internal Auditor, Institutional Compliance & Internal Audit
[Monroe Community College]<http://www.monroecc.edu/>
1000 East Henrietta Road - Rochester, NY 14623-5780
www.monroecc.edu<http://www.monroecc.edu/>

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Sonny Carter FBI File
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The FBI File for Manley Lanier "Sonny" Carter, Jr., M.D., who died in April 1991.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

title: CORA Request – Bodycam, Dashcam, and In-Car Video – Maya Dumas Arrest (July 16, 2024)

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: CORA Request – Bodycam, Dashcam, and In-Car Video – Maya Dumas Arrest (July 16, 2024)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I respectfully request the following records related to the arrest of Maya Dumas (age 25) on July 16, 2024, in Trinidad, Colorado (ZIP 81082):

Body-worn camera footage from all Trinidad Police Department officers who responded to the disturbance call and made contact with Ms. Dumas.

Dashcam footage from any patrol vehicle present at or near the scene, documenting arrival, on-scene interaction, or surrounding context.

Rear seat in-car camera footage, if Ms. Dumas was transported in a patrol unit.

This request is limited to the timeframe of officer arrival through arrest and transport, and pertains only to the incident involving Ms. Dumas’s arrest on charges of:

Harassment (Insults or Taunts Likely to Provoke a Violent Response)

Third Degree Criminal Trespass

Disorderly Conduct

If redactions are necessary, I consent to the release of all non-exempt portions. If any of the requested video is denied, please provide the legal justification and cite the applicable exemption.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Colorado DOC transgender policies
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All department policy and guidance documents regarding transgender inmates, including but not limited to gender-affirming medical care, housing and treatment by staff. I also request records of any proposed and/or enacted changes to said policies made on or after Nov. 6, 2024 until date of search, if such documents exist.

I request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ileana Garnand

communications.subject: YOUR REQUEST HAS BEEN RECEIVED Re: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Colorado DOC transgender policies
communications.communication:
The Colorado Department of Corrections is a criminal justice agency and, as such, requests will be reviewed and responded to in accordance with the Colorado Criminal Justice Records Act (C.R.S. 24-72-301 et.seq.) 
Requests received by the Records Custodian after 3 pm or any day that the Department of Corrections is officially closed will be considered received as of the next business day. Responses are typically provided within 7 business days of receipt (excluding weekends, holidays). If you have not received your response within 7 business days of receipt, please re-send your request so we can provide a status update. 
If the request is for medical records; the response time is 30 days once a signed HIPAA compliant release of information consent, and any other required documentation, has been received by the medical records technician or designee at the appropriate facility. 
Please note: The Department of Corrections may charge an hourly fee for the research, retrieval and preparation of records. The first hour of research, retrieval and preparation are without charge. Beyond the first hour, the fees may vary depending on the type of record and the discretion of the custodian but will not exceed $33 per hour. You will be advised in advance if your request will incur a fee. 
In addition to the research, retrieval and production fees, there is a .25 per page fee for paper copies. The per page fee is not charged for electronic documents, however, research, retrieval and production fees still apply. Any fees due are payable in advance. Responsive documents will not be produced until payment has been tendered. 
Fees may be waived by the Department on recommendation of the records custodian.

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maine Freedom of Access Act, I hereby request the following records:

All department policy and guidance documents regarding transgender inmates, including but not limited to gender-affirming medical care, housing and treatment by staff. I also request records of any proposed and/or enacted changes to said policies made on or after Nov. 6, 2024 until date of search, if such documents exist.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by 1 M.R.S.A. § 408(6). The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ileana Garnand

communications.subject: **FOAA Request** 202535 Ileana Garnand 6 May 25
communications.communication:
The Maine Department of Corrections has received your request for information under the Maine Freedom of Access Act (FOAA).  Your request will be evaluated to determine if it comes within the FOAA, if it is clear as to what information you are requesting, and if nonconfidential records already exist that would fulfill all or part of your request.  If your request does not come within the FOAA, is not clear, or no records exist, you will be so notified.  If records exist, but they are confidential, you will be notified of the basis for that determination.  If nonconfidential records exist, you will be provided a good faith, nonbinding estimate of the time within which you will be provided the records, as well as an estimate of the costs that are allowed by the FOAA, if applicable.

V/r

Jenna Heald
Maine Department of Corrections
Policy & PowerDMS Assistant
FOAA Coordinator

title: Immigration Judge Zol Rainey"All Remands from Board of Immigration Appeals"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Immigration Judge Zol Rainey"All Remands from Board of Immigration Appeals"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The decisions issued by the Board of Immigration Appeals from December 2021 until the date of processing of this request, arising from cases decided by Immigration Judge Zol Damon Rainey, that were administratively closed, reversed, background check remand, and/or remand (including remands to a different IJ).

I would request any printouts, summaries, spreadsheets, reports, or other records or datasets that may encompass or address how many of removal orders included a negative credibility determination for any Respondent(s) for whom IJ Rainey issued removal orders in protection/form I-589 cases (in other words, decisions on Asylum, Wittholding of Removal, or Relief under the Convention Against Torture), after merits/individual hearings occurred, between December 2021 and the date of processing of this request.

All correspondence or communications in any medium (including but not limited to any email, fax, letter, text/SMS/MMS, memorandum, voicemail, audio recording, sticky-note, or any attachment thereto, and any conversion of any of the foregoing from a digital to analog form/format, or vice-versa) to or from IJ Rainey, from December 2021 through present time, regarding removal or any other immigration proceedings, containing the words "credibility," "credible," "incredible," "incoherent," "demeanor," "candor," "evasive," "non-responsive," "responsiveness," "inconsistent," "consistent," "consistency," "facial expression(s)," "body language," "standard language," or "addendum of law," or any abbreviation, contraction, misspelling, pluralization, or paraphrase thereof.

Copies of each and every "standard language addendum of law" or any substantially similar 'boilerplate' or 'template' document utilized by IJ Rainey as an exhibit in, as an attachment to, or as a drafting aid for any merits decision in a protection/form I-589 matter.

The requested records will be made available to the general public via a FOIA records clearinghouse, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes; rather, the results will be disseminated to interested individuals free of charge, and with no pecuniary gain to the Requestor, who is not the subject of any of these records. Thus, we would request that fees be waived.

Please search all records regarding agency business. You may not exclude searches of files or emails in the personal custody of your officials, such as personal email accounts. Records of official business conducted using unofficial systems or stored outside of official files is subject to the Federal Records Act and FOIA. It is not adequate to rely on policies and procedures that require officials to move such information to official systems within a certain period of time; I exercise and specifically preserve and assert my right to records contained in those files even if material has not yet been moved to official systems or if officials have, through negligence or willfulness, failed to meet their obligations.

If it is your position that any portion of the requested records is exempt from disclosure, I request that you provide an index of those documents as required under Vaughn v. Rosen, describe each document claimed as exempt with sufficient specificity to determine whether it should be exempt under FOIA, and discuss the consequences of disclosing, specifically identifying the reasons why a particular exemption is relevant and correlating those claims with the particular part of a withheld document to which they apply.

If it is your position that a record contains non-exempt segments, but that those non-exempt segments are so dispersed throughout the document as to make segregation impossible, please state what portion of the document is non-exempt, and how the material is dispersed throughout the document. If a request is denied in whole, please state specifically that it is not reasonable to segregate portions of the record for release.

You should institute a preservation hold on information responsive to this request. I intend to pursue all legal avenues to enforce my right of access under the FOIA, including litigation if that becomes necessary. Accordingly, the EOIR is on notice that litigation is reasonably foreseeable.

If it will accelerate release of responsive records to me, please also provide responsive material on a rolling basis.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely yours,

Derrick J. Hensley

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Derrick Hensley

communications.subject: Request Acknowledgement by DOJ-EOIR PAL
communications.communication:
Dear Derrick  Hensley, 

This response acknowledges receipt of your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request by the Executive Office for Immigration Review (EOIR).  Your request has been assigned control number 2025-49127. 

Please be advised that the status of requests submitted through the Public Access Link (PAL) may be tracked at https://foia.eoir.justice.gov/app/Home.aspx, and you will receive an email response to your request upon completion of processing. The status of requests submitted by email or mail may not be trackable through the PAL, but you will still receive an email or mailed response to your request upon completion of processing. (https://foia.eoir.justice.gov/app/Home.aspx) Please ensure the email address you provided in PAL will be able to receive the messages we send you. Messages rejected by your email account will not be rerouted to you. 
Please be aware that EOIR is a component of the Department of Justice and the custodian of records for the “Record of Proceedings” (ROP), which is the compilation of documents and digital audio recordings produced in proceedings before the immigration courts and the BIA. The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) is the custodian of records for the “A-file,” which is a series of records of a person’s immigration history and is maintained and stored by DHS. EOIR is not the custodian of records for DHS or its components, nor does EOIR have access to DHS’s A-files. EOIR does not create an ROP until matters are initiated by DHS. Nevertheless, EOIR may create and maintain ROPs for proceedings other than removal proceedings (i.e., credible fear reviews, bond hearings). You may request a copy of your Notice to Appear (NTA) and full A-file from DHS. (https://www.dhs.gov/foia) 
Note that parties to immigration cases (including respondents and their representatives of record) have the option to request their Record of Proceedings directly from the immigration court or Board of Immigration Appeals. Please see the instructions here: https://www.justice.gov/eoir/ROPrequest. (https://www.justice.gov/eoir/ROPrequest) 

If you have filed a fee waiver request, EOIR will address the fee waiver in a separate letter. Most requests for records of proceedings do not require any fees; however, if the fees for processing the request are estimated to exceed $25.00, EOIR will notify you before processing the request to determine whether you will commit to paying the fee or whether you wish to narrow the scope of your request to reduce the fee. Fees may be charged for searching records at the rate of $4.75 (administrative)/$10.00 (professional) per quarter hour, and for duplication of copies at the rate of $.05 per copy. The first 100 copies and two hours of search time are not charged, and charges must exceed $25.00 before we will charge a fee. 

The FOIA requires an agency to respond within 20 working days after receipt of the request, and EOIR endeavors to meet this standard.  The FOIA permits a ten-day extension of this time period, pursuant to 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(B), based on unusual circumstances.  Your request involves “unusual circumstances,” and EOIR is extending the time period to respond by an additional 10 working days because your request requires the collection of records from field offices, or involves a search, collection, and review of voluminous records, or requires consultation with another agency or two or more agency components. 

EOIR FOIA requests are placed in one of three tracks. Track one is for those requests that seek and receive expedited processing pursuant to subsection (a)(6)(E) of the FOIA. Track two is for simple requests that do not involve voluminous records or lengthy consultations with other entities.  Track three is for complex requests that involve voluminous records and for which lengthy or numerous consultations are required, or those requests that may involve sensitive records.  As a matter of default, your request has been placed in track two for simple requests.  If you have requested expedited processing, EOIR will contact you in a separate letter. 

If you have any questions regarding unusual circumstances, you may contact the EOIR FOIA Service Center or FOIA Public Liaison at EOIR.FOIArequests@usdoj.gov to discuss reformulation or an alternative time frame to process your request, or for any further assistance regarding any aspect of your request. Alternatively, you may contact the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) at the National Archives and Records Administration to inquire about the FOIA mediation services they offer.  The contact information for OGIS is as follows: Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, Room 2510, 8601 Adelphi Road, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001; e-mail at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at (202) 741-5770; toll free at (877) 684-6448; or facsimile at (202) 741-5769. 
 
Sincerely, 

FOIA Intake

communications.subject: DOJ-EOIR FOIA Request # 2025-49127
communications.communication:
Re: 2025-49127  Freedom of Information Act Request for Derrick Hensley Dear Derrick  Hensley, This letter is in response to your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request in which you seek documents regarding the above-referenced individual. Your request either did not contain any of the evidence described below or the evidence that you provided was improper. Therefore, your request has been administratively closed. At any time, you may resubmit your request with proper documentation using the Public Access Link (PAL) (https://foia.eoir.justice.gov/app/Home.aspx) Youhave indicated that you are the authorized representative of Derrick Hensley orthat you are a pro se requester. Under our regulations, we will generallyrelease a photocopy of the record of proceedings with appropriateauthorization of the subject of the records. As such, we require more evidence for release of the record.This response neither confirms nor denies the existence of any record for thenamed individual. If you plan to re-submit a request for this individual, please use the Public Access Link (PAL): https://foia.eoir.justice.gov/app/Home.aspx. (https://foia.eoir.justice.gov/app/Home.aspx) Such evidence may include a completed Form EOIR-59 or (https://www.justice.gov/eoir/page/file/1380121/download) DOJ-361 (https://www.justice.gov/ust/file/doj361_form.pdf/download) signed and dated byyour client (or you, if you are requesting your own records). Alternatively, if you are requesting your own records, you may provide your full name, currentaddress, date and place of birth, and either (1) have your signature witnessed by a notary, or (2) include the following statementimmediately above your signature : “I declare under penalty of perjurythat the foregoing is true and correct. Executed on [date].” If you are a parent or guardian requesting documents for a child, in addition to the above evidence, you must also submit proof ofparentage (e.g., birth certificate) or guardianship (e.g., court order), as well as verification of your ownidentity. Verification of your identity must include your full name, current address, date and place ofbirth, and either (1) your signature witnessed by a notary, or (2) the following statement immediately above your signature: “I declare underpenalty of perjury that the foregoing is true and correct. Executed on [date].” For more information on providing proper documentation for your FOIA request, please visit Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) (justice.gov). (https://www.justice.gov/eoir/freedom-information-act-foia) 
Please be aware that EOIR is a component of the Department of Justice and the custodian of records for the “Record of Proceedings” (ROP), which is the compilation of documents and digital audio recordings produced in proceedings before the immigration courts and the BIA. The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) is the custodian of records for the “A-file,” which is a series of records of a person’s immigration history and is maintained and stored by DHS. EOIR is not the custodian of records for DHS or its components, nor does EOIR have access to DHS’s A-files . EOIR does not create an ROP until matters are initiated by DHS. Nevertheless, EOIR may create and maintain ROPs for proceedings other than removal proceedings (i.e., credible fear reviews, bond hearings). You may request a copy of your Notice to Appear (NTA) and full A-file from DHS (https://www.dhs.gov/foia) Note that parties to immigration cases(including respondents and their representatives of record) have the option torequest their Record of Proceedings directly from the immigration court orBoard of Immigration Appeals. Please see the instructions here: https://www.justice.gov/eoir/ROPrequest. (https://www.justice.gov/eoir/ROPrequest) 
You may contact the FOIA Public Liaison at EOIR.FOIArequests@usdoj.gov (mailto:) for any further assistance and to discuss anyaspect of your request. Alternatively, you may contact the Office of GovernmentInformation Services (OGIS) at the National Archives and Records Administrationto inquire about the FOIA mediation services they offer. The contactinformation for OGIS is as follows: Office of Government Information Services,National Archives and Records Administration, Room 2510, 8601 Adelphi Road,College Park, Maryland 20740-6001; e-mail at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at (202)741-5770; toll free at (877) 684-6448; or facsimile at (202) 741-5769. 

If you are not satisfied with the Executive Office for Immigration Review’sdetermination in response to this request, you may administratively appeal bywriting to the Director, Office of Information Policy (OIP), United StatesDepartment of Justice, 441 G Street, NW, 6th Floor, Washington, D.C. 20530, oryou may submit an appeal through OIP’s FOIA STAR portal by creating an accountfollowing the instructions on OIP’s website https://www.justice.gov/oip/submit-and-track-request-or-appeal (https://www.justice.gov/oip/submit-and-track-request-or-appeal) . Your appeal must be postmarkedor electronically transmitted within 90 days of the date of my response to yourrequest. If you submit your appeal by mail, both the letter and the envelopeshould be clearly marked “Freedom of Information Act Appeal.” If possible, please provide a copy of your original request and this response letter with your appeal. Sincerely, FOIA Intake

communications.subject: DOJ-EOIR FOIA Request # 2025-57928
communications.communication:
Re: 2025-57928 

Dear Derrick  Hensley, This correspondence is in response to your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request dated 05/01/2025 to the Executive Office for Immigration Review (EOIR) in which you seek: 

"(1) The decisions issued by the Board of Immigration Appeals from December 2021 until the date of processing of this request, arising from cases decided by Immigration Judge Zol Damon Rainey, that were administratively closed, reversed, background check remand, and/or remand (including remands to a different IJ); 
(2) I would request any printouts, summaries, spreadsheets, reports, or other records or datasets that may encompass or address how many of removal orders included a negative credibility determination for any Respondent(s) for whom IJ Rainey issued removal orders in protection/form I-589 cases (in other words, decisions on Asylum, Wittholding of Removal, or Relief under the Convention Against Torture), after merits/individual hearings occurred, between December 2021 and the date of processing of this request; 
(3) All correspondence or communications in any medium (including but not limited to any email, fax, letter, text/SMS/MMS, memorandum, voicemail, audio recording, sticky-note, or any attachment thereto, and any conversion of any of the foregoing from a digital to analog form/format, or vice-versa) to or from IJ Rainey, from December 2021 through present time, regarding removal or any other immigration proceedings, containing the words "credibility," "credible," "incredible," "incoherent," "demeanor," "candor," "evasive," "non-responsive," "responsiveness," "inconsistent," "consistent," "consistency," "facial expression(s)," "body language," "standard language," or "addendum of law," or any abbreviation, contraction, misspelling, pluralization, or paraphrase thereof; and 
(4) Copies of each and every "standard language addendum of law" or any substantially similar 'boilerplate' or 'template' document utilized by IJ Rainey as an exhibit in, as an attachment to, or as a drafting aid for any merits decision in a protection/form I-589 matter." 

The third portion of your request as-filed would require the Executive Office for Immigration Review to conduct an unreasonably burdensome search. For this Office to respond to your request, EOIR would have to search through hundreds of emails. The FOIA is not intended to allow requesters to conduct a “fishing expedition” through agency files. Dale v. IRS, 238 F. Supp. 2d 99, 104-05 (D.D.C. 2002). This protects the ability of federal agencies to prioritize their resources notwithstanding any obligation to provide access to records under FOIA. Int’l Counsel Bureau v. U.S. Dep’t of Def., 723 F. Supp. 2d 54, 59–60 (D.D.C. 2010). 

Your request is not reasonably described because it is overly broad and would result in an unreasonably burdensome search. As a result, your request is on hold. Please contact EOIR to clarify your request. If we do not hear from you within 30 calendar days of this notice, we will assume that you are no longer interested and your request will be administratively closed. 
If youneed any further assistance or would like to discuss any aspect of yourrequest, please contact the analyst who processed your request or the EOIR FOIAPublic Liaison at EOIR.FOIArequests@usdoj.gov.Additionally, you may contact the Office of Government Information Services(OGIS) at the National Archives and Records Administration to inquire about theFOIA mediation services they offer. The contact information for OGIS is asfollows: Office of Government Information Services, National Archives andRecords Administration, Room 2510, 8601 Adelphi Road, College Park, Maryland20740-6001; e-mail at (mailto:EOIR.FOIArequests@usdoj.gov) ogis@nara.gov;telephone at (202) 741-5770; toll free at (877) 684-6448; or facsimile at (202)741-5769. (mailto:ogis@nara.gov) 

Sincerely, Madeleine N SlighAttorney Advisor
